column4: Trying to setup NFS shares. On the client (ubuntu box) I run mount hostname:share mount_point and get mount.nfs: mount to NFS server 'rpcbind' failed: RPC Error: Program not registered
any idea what could be up
rpc (part of nfs-server normally) is not running
- if I run rpcinfo -p it shows me that portmap is running
- ya. Now, since the ubuntu box is only the client all I installed was nfs-common and portmap
- I have it there, still doesn't automatically  mount on boot
what happens if you do "sudo mount $mountpoint" after boot ?
the kernel source package, and core headers, ncurses-dev and a compiler
- if I install the kernel source package, will it provide me the current .config file used for 8.10?
no it won't give you the .config
- anyway to get the .config used for the default kernel of 8.10
